intro: Leonurus cardiaca subsp. villosus, commonly known as hairy heartwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purplish flowers from June to August. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Its hairy foliage and distinctive flower clusters make it easily identifiable in the wild.
